name: Amiga LZX Compressed Archive
summary: Learn about .LZX files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: In 1995, Jonathan Forbes and Tomi Poutanen released the LZX utility for Amiga computers. It was available as both shareware and a paid application. It allowed users to compress one or more files and store them in LZX archives.
These days, LZX files are uncommon. However, Amiga users may still possess LZX files, stored on hard drives, floppy disks, or other storage media.

instructions:
Following are the few problems that may cause poor working of LZX file format:

The file may be corrupt. To solve this issue, download the file again or ask the sender to resend the file againThe second reason is infected file in this case scan the file properlyImproper links to the LZX fileRemoval of the description of the LZXNot enough hardware resourcesOutdated drivers of the equipment
You can open an LZX file with Total Commander (Windows), with the UnLZX plug-in installed, or The Unarchiver (Mac).
On an Amiga or in an Amiga emulator, you can use LZX, XAD, or unarc to extract the files an LZX file contains.
